titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to "Yale Reports" Audio Recordings and Transcripts
titlestmt.author: compiled by Michael Lotstein

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday November 30, 2018 at 11:20

did.unittitle: "Yale Reports" Audio Recordings and Transcripts

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The material consists of audio recordings, transcriptions, and press releases regarding broadcasts of Yale Reports , a series of radio programs produced by the Yale University News Bureau. The programs featured Yale professors and guests discussing contemporary issues from 1955 to 1976.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The material consists of audio recordings, transcriptions, and press releases regarding broadcasts of Yale Reports , a series of radio programs produced by the Yale University News Bureau. The programs featured Yale professors and guests discussing contemporary issues from 1955 to 1976.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in three series: I. Audio Recordings, 1955-1976. II. Transcripts, 1955-1970, 1975. III. Press Releases, 1962-1966.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 4-C (YRG 4-C), Office of Public Affairs.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: "Yale Reports" Audio Recordings and Transcripts (RU 1113). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

did.unittitle: Audio Recordings

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

odd.head: General
odd.p: The file for episode 409 contains research items and correspondence related to the broadcast.
